 The Companion's battery level Retrieve the current battery level of the terminal. This is an integer value between 0 and 100. If an error occurs (Companion not connected for example), this value is equal to -1.
 

Detailed Description

Set of functions to control the power management of the Companion.

Function Documentation

- (BOOL) setBacklightTimeout: (NSUInteger)  backlightTimeout
andSuspendTimeout: (NSUInteger)  suspendTimeout 

Configure the Companion's screen light timeouts.

Change the Companion's suspend and backlight timeouts to optimize power consumption. The new values will not necessarily be applied, depending on whether they are within or outside the valid value range supported by the device. In the latter case, the new timeout values are culled to fit the valid range and the setTimeouts request will return NO. The new actual timeouts can then be retrieved from the backlightTimeout and suspendTimeout properties.

Parameters
backlightTimeoutThe backlight timeout value. Value between 10 and 1000.
suspendTimeoutThe suspend timeout value. Value between 10 and 65535.
Returns
YES if the request was executed by the device, NO in the other case.

Properties

- (NSInteger) backlightTimeout
readnonatomicassign

The device's backlight timeout configuration parameter.

This property can be changed by issuing a setTimeouts request

- (NSInteger) suspendTimeout
readnonatomicassign

The device's suspend timeout configuration parameter.

This property can be changed by issuing a setTimeouts request
